      Podemos modificar peridicamente esta Declaracin de privacidad para mantenernos al da con las nuevas tecnologas, las prcticas de la industria y los requisitos regulatorios, entre otras razones. Esperamos que tales cambios sean menores. Toda modificacin no sustancial entrar en vigor inmediatamente despus de la publicacin de una Declaracin de privacidad actualizada e indicaremos la fecha de la ltima modificacin en la parte superior de este documento. Sin embargo, puede haber casos en los que las modificaciones a esta Declaracin de privacidad sean ms significativas. En tales casos, le proporcionaremos un aviso destacado de esos cambios en nuestro sitio web o le enviaremos una notificacin directa. 

      El uso continuado de nuestros productos y servicios luego de la fecha de entrada en vigor de la Declaracin de privacidad significa que acepta la Declaracin de privacidad revisada. Si no est de acuerdo con la Declaracin de privacidad revisada, abstngase de usar nuestros productos y servicios y comunquese con nosotros para cerrar toda cuenta que pueda haber creado.

      Comunquese con nosotros

      Si tiene preguntas acerca de esta Declaracin de privacidad o de su implementacin, puede enviar un correo electrnico a nuestro responsable de proteccin de datos (DPO) a DPO@wdc.com. Tambin puede comunicarse con nosotros a travs de nuestro formulario web o escribirnos a una ubicacin cercana a usted por correo postal, dirigida a: A LA ATENCIN DE: Departamento Legal: pregunta sobre la Declaracin de privacidad.

      Para los clientes de la Unin Europea, hemos inscripto a nuestro DPO en la Comisin de Proteccin de Datos de Irlanda. Si tiene preguntas o inquietudes acerca de nuestras prcticas referidas a la privacidad, lo incentivamos a que se comunique con nuestro DPO a la direccin de correo electrnico indicada anteriormente.

      • POLITYKA PRYWATNOCI
        • Zbieranie i wykorzystywanie danych osobowych
        • Pliki cookie i podobne technologie
        • Ujawnianie danych osobowych
        • Prawa uytkownika (w tym przepisy dotyczce ochrony danych osobowych w stanie Kalifornia)
        • Korzystanie z praw uytkownika
        • Strony internetowe i usugi podmiotw zewntrznych
        • Bezpieczestwo, integralno i przechowywanie informacji
        • Dzieci
        • Globalne przesyanie, przechowywanie i przetwarzanie danych
        • Zmiany w niniejszej Polityce prywatnoci
        • Kontakt z nami

      Polityka prywatnoci

      Data ostatniej modyfikacji: 21 grudnia 2022 r.

      PDF

       

      Niniejsza Polityka prywatnoci wyjania, w jaki sposb Western Digital (Western Digital, my, nas, nasze) gromadzi, wykorzystuje i ujawnia informacje o uytkownikach. Wspomniana Polityka prywatnoci dotyczy wszystkich produktw i usug Western Digital, za wyjtkiem tych, ktre s objte oddzieln polityk prywatnoci.

      W stosownych przypadkach uytkownik wyraa zgod na wykorzystywanie swoich danych zgodnie z postanowieniami niniejszej Polityki prywatnoci za kadym razem, gdy korzysta z naszych produktw lub usug. W zwizku z tym prosimy o zapoznanie si z pen treci niniejszego dokumentu oraz kontakt z nami w przypadku pyta.

      Zbieranie i wykorzystywanie danych osobowych

      Dane osobowe to informacje, ktrych mona uy w celu bezporedniej lub poredniej identyfikacji uytkownika. Dane osobowe obejmuj rwnie informacje powizane z danymi, ktrych mona uy w celu identyfikacji bezporedniej lub poredniej. Dane osobowe nie obejmuj informacji, ktrym nieodwracalnie nadano charakter anonimowy lub zbiorczy, uniemoliwiajc tym samym identyfikacj uytkownika, rwnie w poczeniu z innymi danymi. Przetwarzane przez nas informacje pozbawione danych identyfikacyjnych bdziemy przechowywa i wykorzystywa w takiej samej formie.

      Poniej przedstawiamy rodzaje danych osobowych, ktre moemy gromadzi, a take moliwe sposoby ich wykorzystywania:

      Jakie dane osobowe gromadzimy?

      W zalenoci od uytkowanych produktw i usug moemy gromadzi i gromadzilimy, w tym w cigu ostatnich 12 miesicy, rne rodzaje danych osobowych przekazywanych nam przez uytkownikw lub dotyczcych uytkownikw:

      • Osobiste numery identyfikacyjne, w tym imi i nazwisko, nazwa uytkownika, adres e-mail, numer telefonu, adres korespondencyjny lub adres wysyki.
      • Informacje handlowe, w tym produkty lub usugi zakupione bd rozpatrywane przez klientw, informacje o koncie Western Digital, a take informacje uwierzytelniajce, adres rozliczeniowy, adres wysyki i dane kontaktowe.
      • Informacje finansowe, w tym pewne ograniczone informacje o karcie kredytowej lub debetowej.
      • Cechy osobiste, takie jak dane demograficzne, w tym lokalizacja, wiek, pe, wysoko dochodw, zatrudnienie lub poziom wyksztacenia.
      • Oglne informacje o lokalizacji. W miar dostpnoci nasze usugi mog korzysta z GPS, lokalizacji uzyskanej na podstawie adresu IP uytkownika i innych technologii w celu okrelenia przyblionej lokalizacji komputerw, telefonw lub innych urzdze, na ktrych uytkownik instaluje lub uzyskuje dostp do naszych produktw lub usug.
      • Informacje dotyczce aktywnoci w internecie lub innej sieci elektronicznej, w tym historia przegldania, historia wyszukiwania, informacje dotyczce obsugi naszych produktw i usug, np. rodzaj urzdzenia, z ktrego korzysta uytkownik, konfiguracja tego urzdzenia, niepowtarzalny numer identyfikacyjny tego urzdzenia, jego adres IP, system operacyjny uytkownika, rodzaj przegldarki internetowej, z ktrej korzysta uytkownik, informacje na temat uytkowania i przegldania stron, informacje diagnostyczne i podsumowujce sesj, statystyki uycia procesora i inne statystyki, informacje o poczeniach API, informacje o awarii usugi, status sieci, informacje o wykorzystaniu pamici, wyszukiwane hasa, dane o atrybutach plikw (wczajc w to atrybuty zdj, filmw, plikw muzycznych i dokumentw).
      • Informacje zawodowe lub zwizane z zatrudnieniem, takie jak stanowisko, funkcja, zawd, poprzednie dowiadczenie zawodowe lub obecny bd byy pracodawca.
      • Wnioski wycignite na podstawie danych osobowych, takie jak informacje o zainteresowaniach lub preferencjach zakupowych.
      • Wraliwe dane osobowe, w szczeglnoci informacje o karcie kredytowej lub debetowej, ktre s wykorzystywane przez nasz system przetwarzajcy patnoci w celu realizacji danej transakcji.

      Oprcz powyszych kategorii danych osobowych uytkownik moe zdecydowa si na przekazywanie dodatkowych danych osobowych, gdy tworzy konto, wypenia formularz, dostarcza nam zdjcie lub skada wniosek o zatrudnienie.

      W jaki sposb gromadzimy dane osobowe?
      • Informacje przekazywane przez uytkownikw: Moemy gromadzi dane osobowe dostarczane nam przez uytkownikw, gdy korzystaj oni z naszych produktw i usug, zakadaj konta, kontaktuj si z nami, bior udzia w ankietach, uczestnicz w dyskusjach na forach lub czatach internetowych, aplikuj do pracy, zapisuj si do naszego newslettera lub nawizuj z nami kontakt podczas organizowanych spotka bd w inny sposb. Informacje o patnociach: gdy uytkownik dokonuje patnoci, moemy gromadzi jego dane osobowe w zwizku z dokonanym zakupem. 
      • Informacje dotyczce korzystania z naszych produktw i usug: Gdy uytkownik korzysta z naszych produktw i usug, w tym naszej strony internetowej oraz aplikacji mobilnych i komputerowych, lub przeglda nasze wiadomoci e-mail czy reklamy, moemy gromadzi informacje pozyskiwane z lub dotyczce komputerw, telefonw lub innych urzdze, na ktrych instalowane s nasze produkty lub usugi bd ktre zapewniaj uytkownikowi dostp do tych produktw lub usug. Cz z tych informacji moe by gromadzona przez nas automatycznie. Aby dowiedzie si wicej o tym, w jaki sposb uywamy technologii ledzenia sieci Web oraz jakie moliwoci wyboru ma uytkownik, prosimy zapozna si z nasz Polityk plikw cookie.
      • Informacje od stron trzecich: Moemy zbiera informacje od stron trzecich, w tym partnerw biznesowych, agencje marketingowe i usugodawcw. Mog to by dane kontaktowe uytkownikw pozyskane od naszych partnerw marketingowych, z ktrymi prowadzimy wsplne dziaania marketingowe lub wizerunkowe, adresy IP uytkownikw lub informacje o lokalizacji pozyskane od usugodawcw w celu oferowania okrelonych produktw i usug wedug lokalizacji uytkownika, informacje z serwisw spoecznociowych w celu uwierzytelnienia uytkowania produktu bd informacje, do ktrych dostp nasze produkty lub usugi uzyskay za zgod uytkownika.
      • Informacje ze rde publicznych: Moemy gromadzi informacje ze rde i dokumentw rzdowych oraz innych publicznie dostpnych informacji.
      Jak wykorzystujemy zebrane dane osobowe?

      Moemy wykorzystywa dane osobowe do celw opisanych w niniejszej Polityce prywatnoci. Oglnie rzecz biorc, wykorzystujemy dane osobowe, aby dostarcza, udoskonala, rozwija i personalizowa dowiadczenia konsumenckie uytkownika w odniesieniu do naszych produktw i usug, kontaktowa si z uytkownikami, oferowa im ukierunkowane reklamy i usugi, a take chroni nasz firm i naszych uytkownikw. Moemy to robi na podstawie zgody uytkownika w celu realizacji obowizku prawnego, w celu realizacji umowy zawartej z uytkownikiem lub dla naszych uzasadnionych interesw  w zakresie dozwolonym przez obowizujce prawo. Firma Western Digital Technologies, Inc. zbiera i przetwarza dane osobowe oraz decyduje o sposobie przetwarzania danych osobowych uytkownikw jako administrator tych danych w nastpujcych celach:

      • Dostarczanie, udoskonalanie, rozwijanie i personalizowanie dowiadcze konsumenckich uytkownika w odniesieniu do naszych produktw i usug: moemy wykorzystywa dane osobowe, aby pomc nam dostarcza, udoskonala, rozwija i personalizowa dowiadczenia konsumenckie uytkownika w odniesieniu do naszych produktw i usug. Obejmuje to posugiwanie si danymi osobowymi w celach takich jak analiza danych, badania i audyty. Moemy realizowa tego rodzaju przetwarzanie informacji na podstawie zgody uytkownika lub w naszym uzasadnionym interesie, w ktrym ley oferowanie uytkownikom naszych produktw i usug, a take w celu zapewnienia cigoci naszej dziaalnoci biznesowej. W przypadku gdy uytkownik bierze udzia w loterii, konkursie lub innej promocji, podane przez niego dane osobowe mog zosta wykorzystane do administrowania takimi programami. Niektre z tych programw s objte dodatkowym regulaminem, w ktrego treci mog znajdowa si dalsze informacje dotyczce wykorzystywania przez nas danych osobowych. W zwizku z tym zalecamy, aby przed przystpieniem do programu dokadnie zapozna si z jego regulaminem.
      • Kontaktowanie si z uytkownikami: Moemy wykorzystywa dane osobowe w celu odpowiadania na pytania uytkownika i kontaktowania si z nim w sprawie wanych powiadomie, w tym powiadomie zwizanych z kontem uytkownika, produktami, usugami, transakcjami lub zmianami naszych polityk i warunkw. Takie przetwarzanie jest stosowane, poniewa jest niezbdne do realizacji umowy zawartej z uytkownikiem lub opiera si na naszym uzasadnionym interesie w kontakcie z uytkownikiem w celu dostarczenia mu naszych produktw i usug. Moemy rwnie wykorzystywa dane osobowe do komunikowania si z uytkownikiem w sprawie jego poda o prac. Nasze powiadomienia o prywatnoci dla osb skadajcych podanie o prac i pracownikw zawieraj dodatkowe informacje dotyczce gromadzonych przez nas danych osobowych oraz sposobu, w jaki wykorzystujemy dane osobowe w zwizku z podaniami o prac. Za uprzedni wyran zgod uytkownika moemy uywa jego danych osobowych do przesyania korespondencji marketingowej zwizanej z produktami i usugami Western Digital oraz moemy udostpnia dane osobowe uytkownika partnerom zewntrznym, ktrzy mog wysya do niego korespondencj marketingow zwizan z oferowanymi przez nich produktami i usugami. W sytuacji, gdy uytkownik chce zrezygnowa z otrzymywania drog elektroniczn korespondencji marketingowej, prosimy o kontakt z nami w celu wycofania udzielonej zgody. Przekazane przez uytkownika informacje mog by przez nas uywane do przetwarzania i udzielania odpowiedzi na przesyane przez niego zgoszenia.
      • Oferowanie i ocena ukierunkowanych reklam i usug: moemy posugiwa si danymi osobowymi w celu przekazywania uytkownikowi spersonalizowanych reklam, rwnie na stronach internetowych i w aplikacjach podmiotw zewntrznych, a take w celu oceny skutecznoci naszych kampanii promocyjnych. Aby dowiedzie si wicej o tym, w jaki sposb uywamy technologii ledzenia sieci Web do przekazywania spersonalizowanych reklam, prosimy zapozna si z nasz Polityk plikw cookie. Moemy rwnie posugiwa si dopasowywaniem odbiorcw, aby dotrze do osb (lub osb podobnych do innych osb), ktre korzystay z naszych produktw i usug lub ktre znajduj si w przynajmniej jednej spord naszych baz danych. Jest to realizowane przez nas poprzez przekazanie listy haszowanych adresw e-mail partnerowi reklamowemu lub doczenie piksela od partnera reklamowego do naszych wasnych produktw i usug oraz przez dopasowanie wsplnych czynnikw naszych danych i danych partnera reklamowego przez partnera reklamowego.
      • Wspieranie bezpieczestwa: moemy wykorzystywa dane osobowe w celu weryfikacji kont i aktywnoci uytkownikw oraz w celu wspierania bezpieczestwa, na przykad poprzez monitorowanie naduy i prowadzenie dochodze w zwizku z podejrzan lub potencjalnie nielegaln dziaalnoci bd naruszeniem naszych warunkw lub polityki. Takie przetwarzanie jest stosowane, poniewa jest niezbdne do realizacji umowy zawartej z uytkownikiem lub opiera si na naszym uzasadnionym interesie, w ktrym ley zapewnianie bezpieczestwa naszych produktw i usug.
      • Przetwarzanie patnoci: Nasz system przetwarzajcy patnoci moe wykorzystywa dane osobowe uytkownika, w tym informacje handlowe i finansowe, w szczeglnoci do przetwarzania patnoci i opat transakcyjnych zwizanych z produktem lub usug, ktre zamawia.

      W przypadku kadego opisanego powyej sposobu wykorzystywania danych osobowych wymagajcego uprzedniej wyranej zgody uytkownika zgodnie z obowizujcym prawem, uytkownik moe wycofa swoj zgod, kontaktujc si z nami przez formularz internetowy.

      Jako firma o zasigu globalnym Western Digital Corporation posiada szereg podmiotw zalenych dziaajcych w rnych systemach prawnych. Kady z nich gromadzi, przetwarza i decyduje o sposobie przetwarzania danych osobowych jako administrator tych danych, aby dostarcza uytkownikom zamwione przez nich produkty i usugi.

      Pliki cookie i podobne technologie

      Wykorzystujemy i w cigu ostatnich 12 miesicy wykorzystywalimy pliki cookie i podobne technologie, aby dostarcza, chroni i udoskonala nasze produkty i usugi, w tym poprzez personalizacj treci, zdobywanie wiedzy o zachowaniach uytkownikw i zwikszanie poziomu bezpieczestwa uytkowania naszych rozwiza. Oprcz tego wykorzystujemy te technologie w celu przekazywania uytkownikom spersonalizowanych reklam, rwnie na stronach internetowych i w aplikacjach podmiotw zewntrznych, a take w celu oceny skutecznoci naszych kampanii promocyjnych.

      Aby dowiedzie si wicej o tym, w jaki sposb uywamy plikw cookie i technologii ledzenia sieci Web oraz jakie moliwoci wyboru ma w zwizku z tym uytkownik, prosimy zapozna si z nasz Polityk plikw cookie.

      Ujawnianie danych osobowych

      Udostpniamy okrelone dane osobowe partnerom strategicznym i innym odbiorcom opisanym poniej do celw opisanych w niniejszej Polityce prywatnoci.

      Usugodawcy i inne firmy

      Moemy udostpnia dane osobowe usugodawcom i innym firmom, ktre wiadcz w naszym imieniu usugi, takie jak hosting stron internetowych; usugi zwizane z poczt elektroniczn; marketing; reklam; sponsorowanie loterii, konkursw i innych promocji; przeprowadzanie audytw; przetwarzanie patnoci; realizacja zamwie; analiza danych; obsuga klienta; prowadzenie bada rynkowych i bada poziomu satysfakcji klientw; usugi przechowywania danych w chmurze; a take inne usugi wspierajce dostarczanie lub sprzeda naszych produktw i usug. Moemy rwnie udostpnia dane osobowe uytkownika reklamodawcom, dostawcom analiz danych i serwisom spoecznociowym, ktre pomagaj nam w formuowaniu rekomendacji produktowych, komunikacji marketingowej i wysyaniu odpowiednich treci. Wspomniane firmy maj obowizek ochrony danych uytkownikw i mog by zlokalizowane w dowolnym miejscu na wiecie, w ktrym prowadzimy dziaalno.

      Podmioty zalene i korporacyjne transakcje biznesowe

      Zastrzegamy sobie prawo do udostpniania danych osobowych wszystkim podmiotom zalenym od Western Digital Corporation. W przypadku fuzji, reorganizacji, przejcia, powstania przedsibiorstwa joint venture, przeniesienia, wydzielenia, transferu, sprzeday lub rozdysponowania naszej firmy w czci lub w caoci, w tym w ramach postpowania upadociowego lub podobnego, wszelkie zgromadzone dane osobowe mog zosta przekazane waciwej stronie trzeciej.

      Zgodno z przepisami prawa i bezpieczestwo

      Istniej sytuacje, w ktrych moe wystpi konieczno ujawnienia przez nas danych osobowych  w zwizku z wymogami prawa, w wyniku przeprowadzonej procedury prawnej lub postpowania sdowego bd w odpowiedzi na wniosek organw administracji publicznej lub rzdowej dziaajcych w kraju zamieszkania uytkownika lub poza jego granicami. Informacje te moemy ujawni rwnie, jeli uznamy, e jest to niezbdne lub waciwe ze wzgldu na bezpieczestwo narodowe, egzekwowanie prawa lub inny wany interes spoeczny.  Ponadto moemy ujawni dane osobowe take, gdy w dobrej wierze stwierdzimy, e jest to w uzasadniony sposb niezbdne do ochrony naszych praw i zastosowania dostpnych rodkw naprawczych, egzekwowania naszych warunkw i postanowie, wszczcia dochodzenia w sprawie oszustwa bd ochrony naszej dziaalnoci lub uytkownikw.

      Prawa uytkownika (w tym przepisy dotyczce ochrony danych osobowych w stanie Kalifornia)

      Podejmujemy naleyte kroki, aby dane osobowe uytkownikw byy dokadne, kompletne i aktualne. W zalenoci od miejsca zamieszkania uytkownicy mog posiada opisane poniej prawa.

      • Prawo do informacji o gromadzonych przez nas danych osobowych, w tym rde, z ktrych zbierane s dane osobowe, naszych celach ich gromadzenia oraz kategorii odbiorcw, ktrym udostpnilimy dane osobowe uytkownika, w tym wszelkich informacji udostpnianych stronom trzecim w ich celach marketingowych
      • Prawo dostpu do przetwarzanych przez nas danych osobowych w ustrukturyzowanej i ustandaryzowanej formie
      • Prawo do usunicia danych osobowych
      • Prawo do rezygnacji ze sprzeday lub udostpniania danych osobowych stronom trzecim
      • Prawo do rezygnacji z reklamy ukierunkowanej, w tym udostpniania danych osobowych stronom trzecim na potrzeby szeroko rozumianego kontekstu reklamy behawioralnej
      • Prawo do rezygnacji z podejmowania niektrych zautomatyzowanych decyzji
      • Prawo do poprawiania lub sprostowania wszelkich niedokadnych informacji dotyczcych uytkownika

      Korzystanie z praw uytkownika

      Aby skorzysta ze swoich praw, uytkownik moe uy formularza internetowego. Na prob uytkownika odpowiemy w terminie wymaganym przez obowizujce prawo (zasadniczo w cigu 30 dni).

      Zgodnie z wymogami prawa i majc na celu ochron prywatnoci oraz zagwarantowanie bezpieczestwa danych osobowych, moemy zwrci si do uytkownika z prob o udzielenie informacji, ktre pozwol nam potwierdzi jego tosamo i uprawnienia dostpu do tych danych oraz umoliwi nam wyszukanie i dostarczenie uytkownikowi przechowywanych przez nas danych osobowych. Zdarzaj si sytuacje, w ktrych obowizujce prawo lub wymogi prawne zezwalaj na odrzucenie wniosku lub nakadaj na nas taki obowizek.

      Jeli uytkownik jest mieszkacem Kalifornii lub innego stanu bd jurysdykcji, w ktrej zapewnione jest prawo do rezygnacji ze sprzeday lub udostpniania przez nas danych osobowych stronom trzecim w celu wykorzystania danych uytkownika opisanych powyej, w tym w szeroko rozumianym kontekcie reklamy behawioralnej, powinien:

      • zoy wniosek, uzupeniajc formularz Rezygnacja ze sprzeday i udostpniania danych osobowych dostpny tutaj i wskazujc ch rezygnacji ze sprzeday (np. udostpniania danych naszym partnerom do potrzeb dopasowywania odbiorcw innymi rodkami ni pliki cookie czy technologie ledzenia sieci Web, o ktrych mowa w punkcie (2) poniej), oraz 
      • klikn Preferencje dotyczce ciasteczek w poniszej stopce i wybra pozycj Nie w opcjach plikw cookie zwizanych z wydajnoci i funkcjonalnoci oraz reklamami, a nastpnie klikn przycisk Potwierd preferencje. Spowoduje to dezaktywacj plikw cookie zwizanych z wydajnoci, funkcjonalnoci i reklamami oraz technologii ledzenia sieci Web na naszej stronie. Obejmuje to rwnie technologie wykorzystywane do celw dopasowywania odbiorcw i personalizacji reklam. Dezaktywacja tych plikw cookie i technologii ledzenia sieci Web moe mie zastosowanie wycznie do konkretnej przegldarki internetowej, z poziomu ktrej kliknito cze. W przypadku zmiany ustawie preferencje mog ulec zresetowaniu.

      Upowaniony przedstawiciel: Uytkownik moe upowani przedstawiciela do zoenia wniosku w jego imieniu, pod warunkiem e zostanie mu przekazana pisemna, podpisana przez uytkownika zgoda na zoenie wniosku, a przedstawiciel dodatkowo bdzie w stanie potwierdzi nam swoj tosamo.  Jeli uytkownik zamieszkujcy w Kalifornii chce wyznaczy przedstawiciela do celw zoenia wniosku, przedstawiciel musi zgosi ten fakt w biurze Sekretarza Stanu Kalifornia i przesa nam egzemplarz zgoszenia rejestracyjnego razem ze zweryfikowanym wnioskiem konsumenckim uytkownika. W celu zoenia wniosku upowaniony przedstawiciel powinien postpowa zgodnie z powyszymi instrukcjami, a dodatkowo przesa pisemn, notarialnie powiadczon deklaracj upowaniajc go do dziaania w imieniu uytkownika, na poniszy adres: Legal Department, 5601 Great Oaks Parkway, San Jose, California, 95119 USA. Jeli upowaniony przedstawiciel uytkownika ma penomocnictwo, wykonanie tych czynnoci moe nie by konieczne.

      Aby skorzysta ze swoich praw, mona rwnie skontaktowa si z nami telefonicznie, dzwonic pod numer 888-914-9661 (numer PIN: 228663). Uytkownik ma take prawo do zoenia przed waciwym organem ochrony danych skargi dotyczcej przetwarzania swoich danych osobowych. Uytkownik moe rwnie sprzeciwi si dalszemu przetwarzaniu danych osobowych lub ograniczy ich przetwarzanie, a take odwoa si od wszelkich decyzji w ramach korzystania z przysugujcych mu praw. Korzystajc z przysugujcych mu praw, uytkownik nie spotka si z adnymi reperkusjami z naszej strony.

      Jeli uytkownik zada usunicia swoich danych, straci on dostp do wszystkich kont Western Digital. Nie jestemy zobowizani do przechowywania danych uytkownika, w zwizku z czym moemy usun je bez ponoszenia jakiejkolwiek odpowiedzialnoci. W stosownych przypadkach zastrzegamy sobie jednak prawo do zachowania informacji dotyczcych uytkownika, jeli uznamy, e mog one by niezbdne do zapobiegania oszustwom lub przyszym naduyciom, jeli jest to wymagane prawem lub w uzasadnionych celach, takich jak analiza informacji niebdcych danymi osobowymi, odzyskiwanie konta, utrzymywanie funkcjonalnoci lub bezpieczestwa naszych systemw, przeprowadzanie audytw naszych raportw lub egzekwowanie naszych praw i obowizkw wynikajcych z podpisanych przez nas umw.

      Strony internetowe i usugi podmiotw zewntrznych

      Oferowane przez nas produkty i usugi, wczajc w to nasze strony internetowe i media cyfrowe, mog zawiera cza lub oferowa dostp do stron internetowych, produktw i usug podmiotw zewntrznych. Nie ponosimy odpowiedzialnoci za praktyki w zakresie ochrony prywatnoci stosowane przez te podmioty ani za informacje lub treci zawarte w ich produktach i usugach. Niniejsza Polityka prywatnoci dotyczy wycznie informacji, ktre s gromadzone przez nas. Zachcamy do zapoznania si z polityk prywatnoci stosownych podmiotw zewntrznych przed rozpoczciem korzystania z ich stron internetowych, produktw lub usug.

      Bezpieczestwo, integralno i przechowywanie informacji

      Wane jest, aby kady uytkownik w odpowiedni sposb zabezpieczy swoje produkty Western Digital, dane uwierzytelniajce konta oraz komputery lub inne urzdzenia przed dostpem osb niepowoanych. W przypadku podejrzenia naruszenia bezpieczestwa konta lub danych osobowych prosimy o jak najszybszy kontakt z nami. Naley pamita, e pomimo naszych stara na rzecz zapewnienia uzasadnionych i odpowiednich (w tym elektronicznych, fizycznych i proceduralnych) rodkw bezpieczestwa aden system bezpieczestwa nie jest nieprzenikniony. W razie naruszenia bezpieczestwa niezwocznie powiadomimy o tym uytkownika oraz odpowiednie organy, jeeli wymaga tego prawo.

      Przechowujemy dane osobowe uytkownika zgodnie z obowizujcym prawem o ochronie danych. Czynimy to zgodnie z nasz polityk przechowywania danych tak dugo, jak jest to konieczne do realizacji celw okrelonych w niniejszej Polityce prywatnoci. Zgodnie z nasz polityk dotyczc usuwania danych osobowych wdroymy procedur ich usunicia, chyba e duszy okres przechowywania jest wymagany lub dozwolony przez prawo. Poufne informacje bd wykorzystywane w odniesieniu do konkretnej transakcji, do ktrej miay zosta uyte i bd przechowywane przez nas wycznie przez okres niezbdny do realizacji transakcji lub w inny sposb dozwolony przez uytkownika.

      Dzieci

      Nie zbieramy, nie wykorzystujemy ani nie ujawniamy rozmylnie danych osobowych dzieci w wieku poniej 16 lat. Jeli ustalimy, e zostay przez nas zgromadzone dane osobowe osoby, ktra nie ukoczya 16 lat  lub rwnowanego minimalnego wieku obowizujcego w danym systemie prawnym, a wic przykadowo 13 lat w Stanach Zjednoczonych lub 14 lat w Chiskiej Republice Ludowej (przy czym pastwo to, do celw niniejszej Polityki prywatnoci, nie obejmuje Specjalnego Regionu Administracyjnego Hongkong, Specjalnego Regionu Administracyjnego Makau oraz regionu Tajwanu)  podejmiemy kroki majce na celu jak najszybsze usunicie tych danych. W przypadku posiadania informacji o przekazaniu nam danych osobowych przez osob poniej 16. roku ycia, prosimy o jak najszybszy kontakt z nami.

      Osoby poniej 18. roku ycia, ktre s mieszkacami Kalifornii i bdce zarejestrowanymi uytkownikami naszych produktw lub usug mog  zgodnie z prawem stanu Kalifornia  zwrci si z prob o usunicie treci lub informacji opublikowanych przez siebie publicznie i uzyska pozytywne rozpatrzenie wniosku. Aby wystpi z takim wnioskiem, prosimy o kontakt z nami oraz dostarczenie szczegowych informacji dotyczcych miejsca, w ktrym opublikowane zostay wspomniane treci lub informacje, i potwierdzenie, e jest si autorem posta. W zakresie dozwolonym przez obowizujce prawo dooymy wszelkich stara, aby usun post z publicznie dostpnych stron bd nada mu anonimowy charakter uniemoliwiajcy identyfikacj uytkownika. Naley pamita, e zoenie wniosku nie gwarantuje cakowitego ani penego usunicia opublikowanych treci bd informacji oraz e w pewnych okolicznociach prawo nie wymaga ich usunicia lub nie zezwala na nie nawet po wystosowaniu odpowiedniej proby.

      Globalne przesyanie, przechowywanie i przetwarzanie danych

      Gdy udostpniamy dane osobowe uytkownikw naszym partnerom, podmiotom zalenym od Western Digital i usugodawcom, informacje te mog zosta przesane do pastw spoza Europejskiego Obszaru Gospodarczego lub Chiskiej Republiki Ludowej i/lub tam udostpnione. W takiej sytuacji posuymy si modelowymi klauzulami umownymi przyjtymi przez Komisj Europejsk lub Chisk Administracj Cyberprzestrzeni albo bdziemy opiera si na alternatywnych podstawach prawnych i wdroymy obowizkowe rodki, aby dziaa zgodnie z obowizujcym prawem (np. poprzez stworzenie procesu ujawniania uytkownikowi dodatkowych wymaganych informacji podczas przesyania danych osobowych uytkownika poza Chisk Republik Ludow). W przypadku niektrych naszych usug dane osobowe uytkownika mog by przekazywane na serwery i/lub przechowywane i przetwarzane na serwerach w Stanach Zjednoczonych lub w innych miejscach poza krajem bdcym miejscem zamieszkania uytkownika w celu wiadczenia usug dla uytkownika.

      Zmiany w niniejszej Polityce prywatnoci

      Zastrzegamy sobie prawo do okresowego modyfikowania niniejszej Polityki prywatnoci, aby uwzgldni midzy innymi moliwoci nowych technologii, praktyki branowe i wymogi prawne. Spodziewamy si, e w wikszoci bd to niewielkie zmiany. Wszelkie mniej istotne zmiany wejd w ycie z chwil opublikowania zaktualizowanej Polityki prywatnoci dat ostatniej modyfikacji wskaemy na grze tego dokumentu. Moe si jednak zdarzy, e zmiany w niniejszej Polityce prywatnoci bd miay bardziej istotny charakter. W takich przypadkach poinformujemy o takich zmianach na naszej stronie internetowej zanim wejd one w ycie lub wylemy bezporednio powiadomienie o nich. 

      Dalsze korzystanie z naszych produktw i usug po wejciu w ycie Polityki prywatnoci bdzie oznacza, e uytkownik akceptuje jej now wersj. W sytuacji, gdy uytkownik nie wyraa zgody na uaktualnion Polityk prywatnoci, prosimy o zaprzestanie korzystania z naszych produktw i usug i kontakt z nami w celu zamknicia wszelkich utworzonych kont.

      Kontakt z nami

      W przypadku pyta dotyczcych niniejszej Polityki prywatnoci lub jej wdraania prosimy o kontakt z naszym inspektorem ochrony danych (DPO) pod adresem DPO@wdc.com. Moesz rwnie skontaktowa si z nami za porednictwem naszego formularza internetowego lub wysa do nas list z najbliszej lokalizacji na adres: Do wiadomoci [ATTN]: Dzia prawny pytanie dotyczce Polityki prywatnoci [Legal Department Privacy Statement Question].

      Dla klientw z Unii Europejskiej zarejestrowalimy naszego inspektora ochrony danych (DPO) w pastwowej komisji ds. ochrony danych w Irlandii. W przypadku jakichkolwiek pyta lub wtpliwoci dotyczcych naszych praktyk w zakresie ochrony prywatnoci zachcamy do kontaktu z inspektorem ochrony danych za porednictwem adresu e-mail podanego powyej.

      Privacy Statement

      Last Modified: December 21, 2022

      PDF

       

      This Privacy Statement explains how Western Digital (Western Digital, we, us, or our) collects, uses, and discloses your information. The Privacy Statement applies to all Western Digital products and services, except those products and services that have a separate privacy statement.

      Where applicable, you consent to the use of your information as described in this Privacy Statement each time you use our products or services, so we urge you to read this document in full and Contact Us if you have any questions.

      Collection And Use of Personal Information

      Personal information is information that can be used to directly or indirectly identify you. Personal information also includes information that is linked to information that can be used to directly or indirectly identify you. Personal information does not include information that has been irreversibly anonymized or aggregated so that it can no longer enable us, whether in combination with other information or otherwise, to identify you. To the extent we process de-identified information, we will maintain and use the information in de-identified form.

      Here is a description of the types of personal information we may collect and how we may process it:

      What Personal Information We Collect

      Depending on the products and services you use, we may collect and have collected, including within the preceding 12 months, different kinds of personal information from or about you:

      • Personal identifiers, including name, username, email address, phone number, and mailing or shipping address.
      • Commercial information, including the products or services purchased or considered by customers, information about your Western Digital account and authentication information; billing address, shipping address, and contact details.
      • Financial information, including certain limited credit or debit card information.
      • Personal characteristics, such as demographic data, including your location, age, gender, income level, employment, or level of education.
      • General location information. Where available, our services may use GPS, the location inferred from your IP address, and other technologies to determine the approximate, location of the computers, phones, or other devices on which you install or access our products or services.
      • Internet or other electronic network activity information, including browsing history, search history, and information regarding your interaction with our products and services, such as the type of device you use, your device configuration, your devices unique identifier, the IP address of your device, your operating system, the type of Internet browser that you use, usage information, diagnostic information, browsing information, session summary information, CPU and other usage statistics, API calls, service crash information, network status, storage utilization, search terms, and file attributes (including attributes for photos, videos, music, and documents).
      • Professional or employment-related information, such as position, role, occupation, previous work experience or current or former employer.
      • Inferences drawn from personal information, such as information about your interests or purchase preferences.
      • Sensitive Personal Information, specifically credit or debit card information that is used by our payment processor to help fulfill a transaction you have requested.

      In addition to the above categories of personal information, you may choose to provide us with additional personal information, such as when you create an account, fill in a form, provide us a photograph, or submit an application for employment.

      How We Collect Personal Information
      • Information you provide: We may collect the personal information you provide when you use our products and services, create an account, contact us, participate in a survey, participate in community discussions or chat rooms, apply for employment, sign-up to receive our marketing communications, interact with us at in-person events, or otherwise interact with us. 
      • Information about payments: If you make a purchase, we may collect personal information in connection with the purchase. 
      • Information about use of our products and services: When you use our products and services, including our websites and web, mobile, and desktop applications, or view our emails or advertisements, we may collect information from or about the computers,  phones, or other devices on which you install or access our products or services. We may gather some of this information automatically. Please read our Cookie Statement for more information on how we use web tracking technologies and the choices you have.
      • Information from third parties: We collect information from third parties, including business partners, marketing agencies, and service providers. This may include your contact information from marketing partners when we engage in joint marketing or co-branding activities, your IP address or location information from service providers to offer certain products and services relevant to your location, and data from your social networks to authenticate your product use with us, or that you grant permission to our products or services to access.
      • Information from public sources: We may collect information from government sources and records and other publicly available information.
      How We Use Your Personal Information

      We may use personal information for the purposes described in this Privacy Statement. Generally speaking, we use personal information to provide, improve, develop, and personalize your experience with our products and services, to communicate with you, to offer you targeted advertisements and services, and to protect us and our users. We may do so with your consent, for compliance with a legal obligation, for the performance of a contract with you, or for our legitimate interests, to the extent permitted by applicable laws. Western Digital Technologies, Inc. collects, processes, and determines how to process your personal information as data controller for the following purposes:

      • Providing, improving, developing, and personalizing your experience with our products and services: We may use personal information to help us provide, improve, develop, and personalize your experience with our products and services. This includes using personal information for purposes such as data analysis, research, and audits. We may perform such processing based on your consent or our legitimate interest in offering you products and services and for business continuity. If you enter a sweepstakes, contest, or other promotion, we may use the personal information you provide to administer those programs. Some of these activities have additional rules, which may contain further information about how we use personal information, so we encourage you to read those rules carefully before participating.
      • Communicating with you: We may use personal information to respond to your inquiries and communicate with you about important notices, including notices related to your account, products, services, transactions, or changes to our policies and terms. Such processing is undertaken because it is necessary for the performance of a contract with you or is based on our legitimate interest in interacting with you to provide you with our products and services. We may also use personal information to communicate with you about your employment requests. Our privacy notices to applicants and employees provide additional information concerning the personal information we collect and how we use personal information in connection with your employment requests. Subject to your prior express consent, we may use personal information to send you marketing communications in relation to Western Digitals own products and services, and we may share your personal information with third-party partners who may send you marketing communications in relation to their products and services. If you no longer wish to receive email communications for marketing purposes, please Contact Us to opt-out. We may use your information to process and respond to your requests when you contact us.
      • Offering and measuring targeted advertisements and services: We may use personal information to provide you with personalized advertisements, including on third-party websites and applications, and to determine the effectiveness of our promotional campaigns. Please read our Cookie Statement for more information on how we use web tracking technologies for personalized advertisements and the choices you have. We may also use audience matching to reach people (or people similar to people) who used our products and services or are identified in one or more of our databases. This is done by us providing a list of hashed email addresses to an ad partner or incorporating a pixel from an ad partner into our own products and services, and the ad partner matching common factors between our data and their data.
      • Promoting safety and security: We may use personal information to help verify accounts and user activity, as well as to promote safety and security, such as by monitoring fraud and investigating suspicious or potentially illegal activity or violations of our terms or policies. Such processing is undertaken because it is necessary for the performance of a contract with you or is based on our legitimate interest in helping to ensure the safety of our products and services.
      • Payment processing: Our payment processor may use your personal information, including commercial, and financial information, specifically for processing payments and transaction fees related to a product or service you have requested.

      For any of the uses of your data described above that require your prior express consent under applicable law, note that you may withdraw your consent by contacting us via our webform.

      As a global company, Western Digital Corporation has a number of corporate affiliates in different jurisdictions. Each of these affiliates collects, processes, and determines how to process your personal information as a data controller to help provide you with the products and services you request.

      Cookies and Similar Technologies

      We use and have used within the preceding 12 months cookies and similar technologies to provide, protect, and improve our products and services, such as by personalizing content, understanding user behavior, and providing a safer  experience. We also use these technologies to provide you with personalized advertisements, including on third-party  websites and applications, and to determine the effectiveness of our promotional campaigns.

      Please read our Cookie Statement to learn more about how we use cookies and web tracking technologies and the choices you have.

      Disclosure of Personal Information

      We make certain personal information available to the strategic partners and other recipients described below for the purposes described in this Privacy Statement.

      Service Providers and Other Companies

      We may share personal information with service providers and other companies that provide services on our behalf, such as website hosting; email services; marketing; advertising; sponsoring of sweepstakes, contests, and other promotions; auditing; payment processing; fulfilling customer orders; data analytics; providing customer support; conducting customer research and satisfaction surveys; cloud storage services; and other services that assist in providing or selling our products and services. We also may share your personal information with advertisers, data analytics providers, and social media networks, which assist us with making product recommendations, marketing messaging, and sending you relevant content. These companies are obligated to protect your information and may be located wherever we operate.

      Corporate Affiliates and Corporate Business Transactions

      We may share personal information with all Western Digital Corporation-affiliated companies. In the event of a merger, reorganization, acquisition, joint venture, assignment, spin-off, transfer, or sale or disposition of all or any portion of our business, including in connection with any bankruptcy or similar proceedings, we may transfer any and all personal information to the relevant third party.

      Legal Compliance and Security

      It may be necessaryby law or as a result of legal process, litigation, or requests from public or governmental authorities within or outside your country of residencefor us to disclose personal information. We may also disclose personal information if we determine that for purposes of national security, law enforcement, or other issues of public importance, disclosure is necessary or appropriate.  We may also disclose personal information if we determine in good faith that disclosure is reasonably necessary to  protect our rights and pursue available remedies, enforce our terms and conditions, investigate fraud, or protect our operations or users.

      Your Rights (including your California Privacy Rights)

      We take reasonable steps to ensure that your personal information is accurate, complete, and up-to-date. Depending on where you live, you may have the rights described below.

      • Right to know the personal information that we collect, including the sources from which the personal information is collected, our purpose(s) for collection, and the categories of recipients with whom we have shared your personal information, including any sharing with third parties for their own marketing purposes
      • Right to access, in a structured and standard format, the personal information that we process about you
      • Right to delete your personal information
      • Right to opt-out of the sale or share of your personal information to third parties
      • Right to opt-out of targeted advertising, including the sharing of your personal information to third parties for cross-context behavioral advertising
      • Right to opt-out of certain automated decision making
      • Right to correct or rectify any inaccurate information concerning you

      Exercising Your Rights

      You may fill out our webform to exercise your applicable rights. We will respond to your request in the timeframe required by applicable law (and in general within 30 days).  

      As required by law, and to protect the privacy and security of your personal information, we may request information from you to enable us to confirm your identity and right to access such information, as well as to search for and provide you with the personal information we maintain. There are instances where applicable laws or regulatory requirements allow or require us to deny a request.

      If you are a resident of California or another state or jurisdiction that provides this right, to opt-out of the sale or the sharing of your personal information by us to third parties for the uses of your data described above, including cross-context behavioral advertising:

      • submit a request through the Do Not Sell or Share My Personal Information form available here, specifying you wish to opt-out of sales (such as sharing your information with our partners for audience matching purposes via means other than cookies or web tracking technologies referenced in (2) below); and 
      • click Cookie Preferences in the footer below and toggle the options to No for both Performance and Functionality and Advertising Cookie options, and click Submit Preferences. This will deactivate performance, functionality, and advertising cookies and web tracking technologies on our site, including those used for audience matching purposes and personalized advertisements. Deactivating these cookies and web tracking technologies may only apply to the specific browser from which you click the link, and your preferences may reset if you change your settings.

      Authorized Agent: You may authorize an agent to submit a request on your behalf, so long as you provide the authorized agent written permission signed by you to make a request on your behalf, and your authorized agent additionally is able to verify their identity with us.  If you are a resident of California, and would like to designate an agent for purposes of making a request, your agent must register as such with the California Secretary of State and submit a copy of this registration along with your verified consumer request. Please have your authorized agent follow the instructions above to make a request, and additionally mail your written declaration authorizing the agent to act on your behalf, certified by a notary public, to: Legal Department, 5601 Great Oaks Parkway, San Jose, California 95119 USA. If your authorized agent has power of attorney, it may not be necessary to perform these steps.

      You may also contact us via phone at 888-914-9661 (PIN: 228663) to exercise your applicable rights, and you may lodge a complaint with the competent data protection authority regarding the processing of your personal information. You also may object to, or restrict, the further processing of your personal information, and appeal any decisions involving the exercise of your applicable rights. We will not discriminate against you for the exercise of your applicable rights.

      If you request to delete your data, this would remove your ability to access any Western Digital accounts. We have no obligation to retain your information, and we may delete any or all of your information without liability. We may retain, however, information related to you if we believe it may be necessary to prevent fraud or future abuse, if required by law, or for legitimate purposes, where applicable, such as analysis of non personal information, account recovery, maintaining the functionality or security of our systems, auditing our records, or  enforcing our rights and obligations under our agreements.

      Third-Party Websites And Services

      Our products and services, including our websites and digital media properties, may contain links to or the ability for you to access third-party websites, products, and services. We are not responsible for the privacy practices employed by those third parties, nor are we responsible for the information or content their products and services contain. This Privacy Statement applies solely to information collected by us. We encourage you to read the privacy policies of any third parties before proceeding to use their websites, products, or services.

      Information Security, Integrity, And Retention

      It is important that you take precautions to protect against unauthorized access to your Western Digital products, account credentials, and computers or other devices. If you feel that the security of your account or personal information has been compromised, please immediately Contact Us. Please be aware that, despite our efforts to maintain reasonable and appropriate physical, electronic, and procedural security measures, no security system is impenetrable. In the event of a security breach, we will promptly notify you and the proper authorities if required by law.

      We will store your personal information in accordance with applicable data protection law, retain such information in accordance with our data retention policy for as long as it is necessary to fulfill the purposes outlined in this Privacy Statement, and delete such information in accordance with our deletion policy unless a longer retention period is required or permitted by law, Sensitive Information shall be used for the specific transaction in which it was intended and only retained by us for the period of time needed to complete the transaction or as otherwise permitted by the user.

      Children

      We do not knowingly collect, use, or disclose information from children under the age of 16. If we learn that we have  collected the personal information of a child under the age of 16or the equivalent minimum age depending on the  jurisdiction, such as 13 in the United States or 14 in the Peoples Republic of China (which, for the purposes of this Privacy  Statement, excludes the Hong Kong SAR, Macao SAR and the Taiwan region)we will take steps to delete the information as soon as possible. Please immediately Contact Us if you become aware that a child under the age of 16 has provided us with personal information.

      If you are a California resident under the age of 18, and you are a registered user of our products or services, California law permits you to request and obtain removal of content or information you have publicly posted. To make such a  request, please Contact Us with specific information about where the content or information is posted and attesting that you posted it. We will then make reasonable, good faith efforts to remove the post from prospective public view, or anonymize it so you cannot be individually identified, to the extent required by applicable law. Please be aware that such a request does not ensure complete or comprehensive removal of the content or information you have posted and that there may be circumstances in which the law does not require or allow removal even if requested.

      Information Transfers, Storage, And Processing Globally

      When we share your personal information with our partners, Western Digital-affiliated companies, and service providers, your personal information may be transferred to and/or made accessible from countries out of the European Economic Area or the Peoples Republic of China. In such circumstances, we will enter into model contractual clauses as adopted by the European Commission or the Cyberspace Administration of China, as applicable, or rely on alternative legal bases, and implement mandatory measures to act in accordance with applicable laws (for example, creating a process to disclose additional required information to you when transferring your personal information out of the Peoples Republic of China). For some of our services, your personal information may be transferred to and/or stored and processed on servers located in the United States, or in other locations outside of the country where you reside for the  purpose of providing the services to you.

      Changes To This Privacy Statement

      We may periodically change this Privacy Statement to keep pace with new technologies, industry practices, and regulatory requirements, among other reasons. We expect most such changes to be minor. Any non-material changes will take effect immediately upon posting of an updated Privacy Statement, and we will indicate the Last Modified date at the top of this document. There may, however, be cases where changes to this Privacy Statement may be more significant. In such cases, we will provide you with a prominent notice of such changes on our website or will directly send you a notification. 

      Your continued use of our products and services after the effective date of the Privacy Statement means that you accept the revised Privacy Statement. If you do not agree to the revised Privacy Statement, please refrain from using our products and services and Contact Us to close any account you may have created.

      Contact Us

      If you have any questions regarding this Privacy Statement or its implementation, you may email our Data Protection Officer (DPO) at DPO@wdc.com. You may also reach us via our webform or write to us at a location nearest you via mail addressed to: ATTN: Legal Department - Privacy Statement Question.

      For customers in the European Union, we have registered our DPO with the Irish Data Protection Commission. If you have any questions or concerns about our privacy practices, we encourage you to contact our DPO at the email address above.

      • Privacy Statement
        • Collection And Use of Personal Information
        • Cookies and Similar Technologies

        • Contact Us

      Privacy Statement

      Last Modified: December 21, 2022

      PDF

       

      This Privacy Statement explains how Western Digital (Western Digital, we, us, or our) collects, uses, and discloses your information. The Privacy Statement applies to all Western Digital products and services, except those products and services that have a separate privacy statement.

      Where applicable, you consent to the use of your information as described in this Privacy Statement each time you use our products or services, so we urge you to read this document in full and Contact Us if you have any questions.

      Collection And Use of Personal Information

      Personal information is information that can be used to directly or indirectly identify you. Personal information also includes information that is linked to information that can be used to directly or indirectly identify you. Personal information does not include information that has been irreversibly anonymized or aggregated so that it can no longer enable us, whether in combination with other information or otherwise, to identify you. To the extent we process de-identified information, we will maintain and use the information in de-identified form.

      Here is a description of the types of personal information we may collect and how we may process it:

      What Personal Information We Collect

      Depending on the products and services you use, we may collect and have collected, including within the preceding 12 months, different kinds of personal information from or about you:

      • Personal identifiers, including name, username, email address, phone number, and mailing or shipping address.
      • Commercial information, including the products or services purchased or considered by customers, information about your Western Digital account and authentication information; billing address, shipping address, and contact details.
      • Financial information, including certain limited credit or debit card information.
      • Personal characteristics, such as demographic data, including your location, age, gender, income level, employment, or level of education.
      • General location information. Where available, our services may use GPS, the location inferred from your IP address, and other technologies to determine the approximate, location of the computers, phones, or other devices on which you install or access our products or services.
      • Internet or other electronic network activity information, including browsing history, search history, and information regarding your interaction with our products and services, such as the type of device you use, your device configuration, your devices unique identifier, the IP address of your device, your operating system, the type of Internet browser that you use, usage information, diagnostic information, browsing information, session summary information, CPU and other usage statistics, API calls, service crash information, network status, storage utilization, search terms, and file attributes (including attributes for photos, videos, music, and documents).
      • Professional or employment-related information, such as position, role, occupation, previous work experience or current or former employer.
      • Inferences drawn from personal information, such as information about your interests or purchase preferences.
      • Sensitive Personal Information, specifically credit or debit card information that is used by our payment processor to help fulfill a transaction you have requested.

      In addition to the above categories of personal information, you may choose to provide us with additional personal information, such as when you create an account, fill in a form, provide us a photograph, or submit an application for employment.

      How We Collect Personal Information
      • Information you provide: We may collect the personal information you provide when you use our products and services, create an account, contact us, participate in a survey, participate in community discussions or chat rooms, apply for employment, sign-up to receive our marketing communications, interact with us at in-person events, or otherwise interact with us. 
      • Information about payments: If you make a purchase, we may collect personal information in connection with the purchase. 
      • Information about use of our products and services: When you use our products and services, including our websites and web, mobile, and desktop applications, or view our emails or advertisements, we may collect information from or about the computers,  phones, or other devices on which you install or access our products or services. We may gather some of this information automatically. Please read our Cookie Statement for more information on how we use web tracking technologies and the choices you have.
      • Information from third parties: We collect information from third parties, including business partners, marketing agencies, and service providers. This may include your contact information from marketing partners when we engage in joint marketing or co-branding activities, your IP address or location information from service providers to offer certain products and services relevant to your location, and data from your social networks to authenticate your product use with us, or that you grant permission to our products or services to access.
      • Information from public sources: We may collect information from government sources and records and other publicly available information.
      How We Use Your Personal Information

      We may use personal information for the purposes described in this Privacy Statement. Generally speaking, we use personal information to provide, improve, develop, and personalize your experience with our products and services, to communicate with you, to offer you targeted advertisements and services, and to protect us and our users. We may do so with your consent, for compliance with a legal obligation, for the performance of a contract with you, or for our legitimate interests, to the extent permitted by applicable laws. Western Digital Technologies, Inc. collects, processes, and determines how to process your personal information as data controller for the following purposes:

      • Providing, improving, developing, and personalizing your experience with our products and services: We may use personal information to help us provide, improve, develop, and personalize your experience with our products and services. This includes using personal information for purposes such as data analysis, research, and audits. We may perform such processing based on your consent or our legitimate interest in offering you products and services and for business continuity. If you enter a sweepstakes, contest, or other promotion, we may use the personal information you provide to administer those programs. Some of these activities have additional rules, which may contain further information about how we use personal information, so we encourage you to read those rules carefully before participating.
      • Communicating with you: We may use personal information to respond to your inquiries and communicate with you about important notices, including notices related to your account, products, services, transactions, or changes to our policies and terms. Such processing is undertaken because it is necessary for the performance of a contract with you or is based on our legitimate interest in interacting with you to provide you with our products and services. We may also use personal information to communicate with you about your employment requests. Our privacy notices to applicants and employees provide additional information concerning the personal information we collect and how we use personal information in connection with your employment requests. Subject to your prior express consent, we may use personal information to send you marketing communications in relation to Western Digitals own products and services, and we may share your personal information with third-party partners who may send you marketing communications in relation to their products and services. If you no longer wish to receive email communications for marketing purposes, please Contact Us to opt-out. We may use your information to process and respond to your requests when you contact us.
      • Offering and measuring targeted advertisements and services: We may use personal information to provide you with personalized advertisements, including on third-party websites and applications, and to determine the effectiveness of our promotional campaigns. Please read our Cookie Statement for more information on how we use web tracking technologies for personalized advertisements and the choices you have. We may also use audience matching to reach people (or people similar to people) who used our products and services or are identified in one or more of our databases. This is done by us providing a list of hashed email addresses to an ad partner or incorporating a pixel from an ad partner into our own products and services, and the ad partner matching common factors between our data and their data.
      • Promoting safety and security: We may use personal information to help verify accounts and user activity, as well as to promote safety and security, such as by monitoring fraud and investigating suspicious or potentially illegal activity or violations of our terms or policies. Such processing is undertaken because it is necessary for the performance of a contract with you or is based on our legitimate interest in helping to ensure the safety of our products and services.
      • Payment processing: Our payment processor may use your personal information, including commercial, and financial information, specifically for processing payments and transaction fees related to a product or service you have requested.

      For any of the uses of your data described above that require your prior express consent under applicable law, note that you may withdraw your consent by contacting us via our webform.

      As a global company, Western Digital Corporation has a number of corporate affiliates in different jurisdictions. Each of these affiliates collects, processes, and determines how to process your personal information as a data controller to help provide you with the products and services you request.

      Cookies and Similar Technologies

      We use and have used within the preceding 12 months cookies and similar technologies to provide, protect, and improve our products and services, such as by personalizing content, understanding user behavior, and providing a safer  experience. We also use these technologies to provide you with personalized advertisements, including on third-party  websites and applications, and to determine the effectiveness of our promotional campaigns.

      Please read our Cookie Statement to learn more about how we use cookies and web tracking technologies and the choices you have.

      Disclosure of Personal Information

      We make certain personal information available to the strategic partners and other recipients described below for the purposes described in this Privacy Statement.

      Service Providers and Other Companies

      We may share personal information with service providers and other companies that provide services on our behalf, such as website hosting; email services; marketing; advertising; sponsoring of sweepstakes, contests, and other promotions; auditing; payment processing; fulfilling customer orders; data analytics; providing customer support; conducting customer research and satisfaction surveys; cloud storage services; and other services that assist in providing or selling our products and services. We also may share your personal information with advertisers, data analytics providers, and social media networks, which assist us with making product recommendations, marketing messaging, and sending you relevant content. These companies are obligated to protect your information and may be located wherever we operate.

      Corporate Affiliates and Corporate Business Transactions

      We may share personal information with all Western Digital Corporation-affiliated companies. In the event of a merger, reorganization, acquisition, joint venture, assignment, spin-off, transfer, or sale or disposition of all or any portion of our business, including in connection with any bankruptcy or similar proceedings, we may transfer any and all personal information to the relevant third party.

      Legal Compliance and Security

      It may be necessaryby law or as a result of legal process, litigation, or requests from public or governmental authorities within or outside your country of residencefor us to disclose personal information. We may also disclose personal information if we determine that for purposes of national security, law enforcement, or other issues of public importance, disclosure is necessary or appropriate.  We may also disclose personal information if we determine in good faith that disclosure is reasonably necessary to  protect our rights and pursue available remedies, enforce our terms and conditions, investigate fraud, or protect our operations or users.

      Your Rights (including your California Privacy Rights)

      We take reasonable steps to ensure that your personal information is accurate, complete, and up-to-date. Depending on where you live, you may have the rights described below.

      • Right to know the personal information that we collect, including the sources from which the personal information is collected, our purpose(s) for collection, and the categories of recipients with whom we have shared your personal information, including any sharing with third parties for their own marketing purposes
      • Right to access, in a structured and standard format, the personal information that we process about you
      • Right to delete your personal information
      • Right to opt-out of the sale or share of your personal information to third parties
      • Right to opt-out of targeted advertising, including the sharing of your personal information to third parties for cross-context behavioral advertising
      • Right to opt-out of certain automated decision making
      • Right to correct or rectify any inaccurate information concerning you

      Exercising Your Rights

      You may fill out our webform to exercise your applicable rights. We will respond to your request in the timeframe required by applicable law (and in general within 30 days).  

      As required by law, and to protect the privacy and security of your personal information, we may request information from you to enable us to confirm your identity and right to access such information, as well as to search for and provide you with the personal information we maintain. There are instances where applicable laws or regulatory requirements allow or require us to deny a request.

      If you are a resident of California or another state or jurisdiction that provides this right, to opt-out of the sale or the sharing of your personal information by us to third parties for the uses of your data described above, including cross-context behavioral advertising:

      • submit a request through the Do Not Sell or Share My Personal Information form available here, specifying you wish to opt-out of sales (such as sharing your information with our partners for audience matching purposes via means other than cookies or web tracking technologies referenced in (2) below); and 
      • click Cookie Preferences in the footer below and toggle the options to No for both Performance and Functionality and Advertising Cookie options, and click Submit Preferences. This will deactivate performance, functionality, and advertising cookies and web tracking technologies on our site, including those used for audience matching purposes and personalized advertisements. Deactivating these cookies and web tracking technologies may only apply to the specific browser from which you click the link, and your preferences may reset if you change your settings.

      Authorized Agent: You may authorize an agent to submit a request on your behalf, so long as you provide the authorized agent written permission signed by you to make a request on your behalf, and your authorized agent additionally is able to verify their identity with us.  If you are a resident of California, and would like to designate an agent for purposes of making a request, your agent must register as such with the California Secretary of State and submit a copy of this registration along with your verified consumer request. Please have your authorized agent follow the instructions above to make a request, and additionally mail your written declaration authorizing the agent to act on your behalf, certified by a notary public, to: Legal Department, 5601 Great Oaks Parkway, San Jose, California 95119 USA. If your authorized agent has power of attorney, it may not be necessary to perform these steps.

      You may also contact us via phone at 888-914-9661 (PIN: 228663) to exercise your applicable rights, and you may lodge a complaint with the competent data protection authority regarding the processing of your personal information. You also may object to, or restrict, the further processing of your personal information, and appeal any decisions involving the exercise of your applicable rights. We will not discriminate against you for the exercise of your applicable rights.

      If you request to delete your data, this would remove your ability to access any Western Digital accounts. We have no obligation to retain your information, and we may delete any or all of your information without liability. We may retain, however, information related to you if we believe it may be necessary to prevent fraud or future abuse, if required by law, or for legitimate purposes, where applicable, such as analysis of non personal information, account recovery, maintaining the functionality or security of our systems, auditing our records, or  enforcing our rights and obligations under our agreements.

      Third-Party Websites And Services

      Our products and services, including our websites and digital media properties, may contain links to or the ability for you to access third-party websites, products, and services. We are not responsible for the privacy practices employed by those third parties, nor are we responsible for the information or content their products and services contain. This Privacy Statement applies solely to information collected by us. We encourage you to read the privacy policies of any third parties before proceeding to use their websites, products, or services.

      Information Security, Integrity, And Retention

      It is important that you take precautions to protect against unauthorized access to your Western Digital products, account credentials, and computers or other devices. If you feel that the security of your account or personal information has been compromised, please immediately Contact Us. Please be aware that, despite our efforts to maintain reasonable and appropriate physical, electronic, and procedural security measures, no security system is impenetrable. In the event of a security breach, we will promptly notify you and the proper authorities if required by law.

      We will store your personal information in accordance with applicable data protection law, retain such information in accordance with our data retention policy for as long as it is necessary to fulfill the purposes outlined in this Privacy Statement, and delete such information in accordance with our deletion policy unless a longer retention period is required or permitted by law, Sensitive Information shall be used for the specific transaction in which it was intended and only retained by us for the period of time needed to complete the transaction or as otherwise permitted by the user.

      Children

      We do not knowingly collect, use, or disclose information from children under the age of 16. If we learn that we have  collected the personal information of a child under the age of 16or the equivalent minimum age depending on the  jurisdiction, such as 13 in the United States or 14 in the Peoples Republic of China (which, for the purposes of this Privacy  Statement, excludes the Hong Kong SAR, Macao SAR and the Taiwan region)we will take steps to delete the information as soon as possible. Please immediately Contact Us if you become aware that a child under the age of 16 has provided us with personal information.

      If you are a California resident under the age of 18, and you are a registered user of our products or services, California law permits you to request and obtain removal of content or information you have publicly posted. To make such a  request, please Contact Us with specific information about where the content or information is posted and attesting that you posted it. We will then make reasonable, good faith efforts to remove the post from prospective public view, or anonymize it so you cannot be individually identified, to the extent required by applicable law. Please be aware that such a request does not ensure complete or comprehensive removal of the content or information you have posted and that there may be circumstances in which the law does not require or allow removal even if requested.

      Information Transfers, Storage, And Processing Globally

      When we share your personal information with our partners, Western Digital-affiliated companies, and service providers, your personal information may be transferred to and/or made accessible from countries out of the European Economic Area or the Peoples Republic of China. In such circumstances, we will enter into model contractual clauses as adopted by the European Commission or the Cyberspace Administration of China, as applicable, or rely on alternative legal bases, and implement mandatory measures to act in accordance with applicable laws (for example, creating a process to disclose additional required information to you when transferring your personal information out of the Peoples Republic of China). For some of our services, your personal information may be transferred to and/or stored and processed on servers located in the United States, or in other locations outside of the country where you reside for the  purpose of providing the services to you.

      Changes To This Privacy Statement

      We may periodically change this Privacy Statement to keep pace with new technologies, industry practices, and regulatory requirements, among other reasons. We expect most such changes to be minor. Any non-material changes will take effect immediately upon posting of an updated Privacy Statement, and we will indicate the Last Modified date at the top of this document. There may, however, be cases where changes to this Privacy Statement may be more significant. In such cases, we will provide you with a prominent notice of such changes on our website or will directly send you a notification. 

      Your continued use of our products and services after the effective date of the Privacy Statement means that you accept the revised Privacy Statement. If you do not agree to the revised Privacy Statement, please refrain from using our products and services and Contact Us to close any account you may have created.

      Contact Us

      If you have any questions regarding this Privacy Statement or its implementation, you may email our Data Protection Officer (DPO) at DPO@wdc.com. You may also reach us via our webform or write to us at a location nearest you via mail addressed to: ATTN: Legal Department - Privacy Statement Question.

      For customers in the European Union, we have registered our DPO with the Irish Data Protection Commission. If you have any questions or concerns about our privacy practices, we encourage you to contact our DPO at the email address above.
